clinical_study.brief_title: Long-term Study of Teduglutide in Pediatric Subjects With Short Bowel Syndrome Who Completed the TED-C13-003 Study
clinical_study.official_title: A Retrospective and Prospective, Open-label, Long-term Safety and Efficacy Study of Teduglutide in Pediatric Subjects With Short Bowel Syndrome Who Completed TED-C13-003

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of teduglutide treatment of children with short bowel syndrome (SBS) who completed the TED-C13-003 study over a long-term period. It will evaluate how these children fared after the TED-C13-003 study ended. This study will also offer teduglutide treatment to eligible subjects, regardless of treatment received in TED-C13-003.

primary_outcome.measure: Long-term safety as measured by adverse events
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to each study visit for approximately 3 years
primary_outcome.description: Evaluate the long-term safety of teduglutide treatment in pediatric subjects with SBS, measured by adverse events.

primary_outcome.measure: Long-term safety as measured by growth parameters
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to each study visit for approximately 3 years
primary_outcome.description: Evaluate the long-term safety of teduglutide treatment in pediatric subjects with SBS measured by growth parameters

primary_outcome.measure: Long-term safety as measured by anti-drug antibodies
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to each study visit for approximately 3 years
primary_outcome.description: Evaluate the long term safety of teduglutide treatment in pediatrict subjects with SBS measured by anti-drug antibodies

primary_outcome.measure: Long-termtolerability as measured by reduction in parenteral support (PS) volume
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to each study visit for approximately 3 years
primary_outcome.description: Evaluate the long-term tolerability of teduglutide treatment, measured by PS volume

primary_outcome.measure: Long-term tolerbility as measured by PS infusion duration
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to each study visit for approximately 3 years
primary_outcome.description: Evaluate the long-term tolerability of teduglutide treatment, measured by PS infusion duration

secondary_outcome.measure: Long-term efficacy as measured by reduction in PS volume
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to each study visit for approximately 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Intake diaries will be dispensed for collection of actual PS volume and hours per day

secondary_outcome.measure: Long-term efficacy as measured by PS infusion duration
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to each study visit for approximately 3 years
secondary_outcome.description: Data will be captured in an intake diary completed by the subject/parent/guardian.

other_outcome.measure: Change in Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory (PedsQL) score
other_outcome.time_frame: Approximately every 12 weeks for three years
other_outcome.description: Quality assessments will be made approximately every 12 weeks, folloiwng the nutritional support adjustment guidelines as set forth in the protocol.

other_outcome.measure: Change PedsQL in Family Impact Module score
other_outcome.description: This module is a parent-reported multidimensional instruct that will be completed by the parent or legal guardan

other_outcome.measure: Change PedsQL in GI symptoms sub-scales for food and drink limits and diarrhea
other_outcome.description: The thirteen (13) items of these sub-scales will be completed by either the parent or legal guardian and subject as indicated in the protocol

arm_group.description: TED 0.05mg/kg subcutaneous injections once daily as needed in addition to SOC treatment

intervention.description: Standard safety assessments and adjustments in nutritional support will be provided for all subjects throughout the study, including any teduglutide treatment periods

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Subject provides written informed consent (subject, parent or legal guardian and, as appropriate, subject informed assent) to participate in the study before completing any study-related procedures.
2. Subject completed the TED-C13-003 study (including subjects in the standard of care treatment arm).
3. Subject understands and is willing and able to fully adhere to study requirements as defined in this protocol.
Exclusion Criteria:
There are no exclusion criteria for this study.
